file_content.text: Idiots! Did none of you think to stop an intruder? Or are we issuing invitations?
No matter. You won't disrupt the work I'm doing to stabilize Balmorra.
Call this torture what you will--it ends here.
Spare me the rhetoric.
What you call stability, I call torture.
Your 'work' is barbaric.
Looks like we have a conflict of interest.
But that's why I'm here.
That's because the Republic's idea of freedom is letting dangerous animals roam wild.
So the torture, the interrogations... all from the bottom of your heart?
Now I've heard it all.
I must maintain order. Fear discourages rebellion.
Hand over the Barrager scientists.
Give me what I want.
Aren't we conceited?
Whether you're here out of some misguided attempt to save these criminals or you're after Republic interests, you won't succeed.
The Gorinth Brig and everyone in it serves the Empire--they live for it, they die for it.
Release the prisoners, and you can go free.
Last chance, Vekarr.
And start a planet-wide riot? No wonder the Republic's falling apart.
You're beyond hope.
Your delusions are amusing. The Extractors will cure you of them soon enough.
Now I'm angry.
Disarm the intruder. Alive, if possible. Dead, as an example.
The Empire will maintain control of Balmorra, no matter how many bleeding hearts the Republic has.
Ha! Now, why would we imprison the men who gave us the power to destroy the Republic?
